A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: So sad\, so disappointed. Now I wish we could’ve been treated to Lucas’s original vision of the final trilogy. As flawed as the prequels were they told a story I wanted to know and ultimately paid off entertainment and story wise. Maul\, Qui’Gon\, Windu\, Tyrannus\, young Kenobi and Skywalker\, were many times more interesting and likeable than Rey\, Ren\, Snoke and other forgettables. This sad entry follows a lukewarm Force Awakens and degrades what little was good about that movie. TLJ also commits the cardinal sin of ruining Luke Skywalker whose anticlimactic redemption is jawdroppingly hollow trickery after spending most of the movie cynical and sulking. TLJ is head scratchingly the worst Star Wars Movie with arguably the highest production value. Shame since Rogue One brought to me “A New Hope” in terms of Star Wars movies.
